pageContext.analysis: Trump tweeted an image of a poll by Rasmussen, indicating it showed him at 50 percent approval. Rasmussen consistently has a Republican-leaning bias, and the polling gurus at FiveThirtyEight say that an adjusted rating would have shown Trump at 45 percent in the poll. On the day of the tweet, Trump had an average approval of 42.3 percent in 538's blended poll rating, along with 51.7 percent disapproval. Trump's rating fell in the next Rasmussen poll.
